revised_title: A New Theory on Animal Generation and Sensory Knowledge
tldr: The author discusses the process of animal generation, specifically focusing on viviparous animals, and compares it to the process in oviparous animals. They argue that both types of animals have ovaries containing eggs that are rendered fertile in a similar manner. The author also explores the sensory knowledge of animals, distinguishing between intellectual and sensible knowledge, and how animals have a simple apprehension of objects without self-reflection.
